author: Special Correspondent
text:
The DMDK’s meeting on Thursday clearly sent shockwaves through Tamil Nadu’s politics with Vijayakant’s announcement that the party would contest alone. But there was also a curious intervention by his wife Premalatha that provided a final twist. Unlike past meetings of the DMDK, the one on Thursday saw a unique development. While usually it was Mr. Vijayakant who delivers the final address, Ms. Premalatha chose to “seek” his permission after his speech to make a crucial intervention.

While the DMDK president reiterated four times in his short speech that he would contest “alone”, Ms. Premalatha said like-minded parties could still approach Mr. Vijayakant for talks.

Sources in both the People’s Welfare Front (PWF) and the BJP chose to interpret this as an attempt by Ms. Premalatha to keep the doors open to them. Essentially, they feel it was the DMDK’s way of stating that the party would head the alliance it forms. Speeches by Mr. Vijayakant and Ms. Premalatha have always stood out for their subtle contrasts.
title: Is Premalatha leaving the door open?
